message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.SI 

The paper deals with classification theory and probabilistic networks classifiers, which are commonly studied in the machine learning community. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the discriminative power of a set of features, which falls under the scope of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The asymptotic misclassification probabilities and their closed form expressions are related to probability theory and statistics, which are covered in cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.IT (Information Theory). Finally, the paper proposes a new quantity for assessing the discriminative power of features, which can be considered as a topic in cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
